intro: Dyssodia integerrima, commonly known as the rough dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense heads. It is an important plant in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
